result.execSummary:
All charges against Dylan Jesse Mcconaughey in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dylan Jesse Mcconaughey is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Take medications only as prescribed. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:06 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Timothy Joseph O'Brien, DF: Dylan Jesse Mcconaughey appeared from jail. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. State requests bond. Atty. O'Brien makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:14 PM. kma  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
